Dating: MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before); NEW KINGDOM (not after)
Name: Jar
Description: This terracotta jar comes from the excavations of Diospolis Parva undertaken by W. F. Petrie in 1898-1899. In ovoid form, it is distinguished by the striations on the whole surface and by a slightly elongated neck. The piece could be dated from the Middle Kingdom to the beginning of the New Kindom.
